title: How Does Card Counting Work in Blackjack?
description: Learn the fundamentals of card counting in blackjack. Understand how advantage players track cards to gain an edge over the casino.
author: Protocol 21 Team
content:
Card counting is a blackjack strategy that allows players to track the ratio of high to low cards remaining in the deck. When the deck is rich in high cards (10s, face cards, and Aces), the player has an advantage. When it's rich in low cards, the house has an advantage.

## The Basic Concept

At its core, card counting works by assigning point values to cards as they're dealt. In the popular Hi-Lo system:

- Cards 2-6 = +1
- Cards 7-9 = 0
- Cards 10-A = -1

As cards are dealt, you keep a running count by adding or subtracting based on each card you see.

## Why It Works

Blackjack is unique among casino games because previous hands affect future outcomes. Unlike roulette where each spin is independent, in blackjack, cards that have been dealt cannot appear again until the deck is reshuffled.

title: Hi-Lo Card Counting System: Complete Guide for Beginners
description: Master the Hi-Lo card counting system with our comprehensive guide. Perfect for beginners looking to learn the most popular counting method.
author: Protocol 21 Team
content:
The Hi-Lo system is the most widely used card counting method in blackjack. Developed by Harvey Dubner in 1963 and later refined by Stanford Wong, it offers an excellent balance of simplicity and effectiveness.

## Card Values

In Hi-Lo, every card is assigned a value:

- **Low cards (2-6):** +1
- **Neutral cards (7-9):** 0
- **High cards (10, J, Q, K, A):** -1

## Running Count vs. True Count

The running count is your cumulative total. But in multi-deck games, you need to calculate the true count by dividing your running count by the number of decks remaining.

## Betting Strategy

Increase your bets when the true count is positive (+2 or higher) and decrease when it's negative. A positive count means the remaining deck is rich in 10s and Aces, giving you the edge.
